TI: AVP (4-8) May Stimulate a G Protein-coupled Receptor in Rat Hippocampal Synaptosomal Membranes.
AB: As a metabolite of arginine-vasopressin, AVP(4-8) has been shown to have potent memory-enhancing activity and to induce a series of physiological and biochemical events in rat brain. GTP-binding protein is known to be a revolving stage of transmembrane signal transduction to mediate physiochemical responses of neurotransmitters and neuromodulators. A specific binding site of AVP(4-8) in the rat hippocampal synaptic membranes was identified by radio-receptor assay and after binding to membranes, AVP(4-8) enhanced the binding of Guanosine -5'-O-(3-[(35)S]thio)triphosphate ([(35)S]GTPgammaS), and this enhancement could be completely reversed by the antagonist of AVP(4-8), ZNC(C)PR. Based on the alone results, we suggest that AVP(4-8) exerts its function as neurotransmitter through a G-protein-coupled receptor on the synaptosomal membrane of rat hippocampus.
AD: Shanghai Institute of Biochemistry, the Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shanghai 200031, China. duyc@sunm.shcnc.ac.cn
TA: Sheng Wu Hua Xue Yu Sheng Wu Wu Li Xue Bao (Shanghai)
JT: Sheng wu hua xue yu sheng wu wu li xue bao Acta biochimica et biophysica Sinica
